title: How to learn about computer networking and what is all about - Quora

response.answer_text: Suggested reads: ”Computer Networks: A Systems Approch” 5th edition by Peterson and Davis is a good over view. It’s only 884 pages and you should finish it in a month or less. This a complete overview from the wired and wireless modes used, to applications. It also includes encryption protocols.Then “TCP/IP Sockets Programming in C”, “TCP/IP Sockets Programming in C#”, “TCP/IP Sockets Programming in Java” by Donahoo and Clvert. These are guides on how to use the language specific libraries for TCP/IP and UDP Programming.“TCP/IP Illustrated” Volumns 1 to 3 by W. Richard Stevens. There multiple editions of these books, which are kept up to date by various co-authors. This is deep dive in the C code that actually implements TCP/IP and UDP.“Software Engineering for Internet Applications” by Anderson, Greenspan, and Grumet. From the Preface: “The most concise statement of the course goal is that ‘The student finishes, knowing how to build _amazon.com_ by him or herself.’”

Computer Networking is the practice of interfacing two or more computing devices with each other for the purpose of sharing data. Computer networks are built with a combination of hardware and software. if you want to learn about computer networking than i would suggest you some books of computer networking.
